contentrichtext.text: : ''For other uses, see [[Zenit (disambiguation)]].'' '''Zenit Đozić''' (born 8 October 1961 in [[Bugojno]], [[People's Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina|PR Bosnia-Herzegovina]], [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia|FPR Yugoslavia]]) is a [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnian]] [[actor]], [[humorist]] and [[television producer]]. Known under nicknames '''Zena''' and '''Fu-Do''', he started his entertainment career as early drummer of rock band [[Zabranjeno Pušenje]]. He left Zabranjeno Pušenje before the band recorded its first album, but formed ''[[Top lista nadrealista]]'' with his former band-mates and became one of most prominent members of the group. He then returned to the group on their second album in back vocal capacity, and did the subsequent tour with them. He stayed in [[Sarajevo]] during the [[Bosnian War]] and took part in war-time sketches of ''Top lista nadrealista''. After the war, he finished [[Academy of Performing Arts in Sarajevo|Academy of Performing Arts]] (ASU) in Sarajevo and then received [[Master of Arts (postgraduate)|masters degree]] in television production in [[London]].<ref name="Sarajevo-x">[http://www.sarajevo-x.com/clanak/031031012 Zenit's interview for Sarajevo-x.com]</ref> {{As of|2006}} he is living in [[Sarajevo]] and working as [[television producer]].<ref name="Grazia">Grazia magazine, March 2006 (no. 4)</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Djozic, Zenit | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 8 October 1961 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Djozic, Zenit}} [[Category:Bosnia and Herzegovina rock musicians]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Bosnia and Herzegovina actors]] [[Category:Bosnia and Herzegovina film actors]] [[Category:People from Sarajevo]] [[Category:Television producers]] [[Category:1961 births]]
